website_summaries.verdict: The Polk Signa Solo offers a cheap upgrade over your TV's speakers, but it can't beat the very stiff competition.
pros: The Polk Signa Solo is a cheap way to upgrade your television's sound
It offers Bluetooth and digital connectivity as well as a selection of sound modes
Offers a decent alternative to Bluetooth speakers
cons: Similarly priced sound bars include subwoofers and sound more accomplished

customer_reviews.title: Harsh Rating BUT Deserved
customer_reviews.text: POLK AUDIO should be ashamed. I bought this because I have always trusted the Polk brand. Not anymore. I will start out by what I liked. UH, looked nice and turned on. Now for what I didn't like. It didn't remember my settings after it was turned off. Under powered. Sounded like it was in a box. Not only very little bass there were very little high Freq as well. The remote was awful and flimsy. You had to get within 5' for it to work. No amount of playing with the setting ever got close to a good sound. However, you could understand mid frequency voices above the music unlike some sound bars.
customer_reviews.author: Casch

customer_reviews.title: This is Polk’s Worst Product I’ve ever bought.
customer_reviews.text: I had a Polk Sound bar before it quit and it offered true stereo sound and every thing I could of asked for. This one is basically worthless. Voices are drowned even after adjusting, no depth no stereo. Remote has to be adjusted every single program and is worthless as well. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY ON THIS SOUNDBAR

customer_reviews.title: Amazing sound but lacking accessories.
customer_reviews.text: This sound bar is so amazing, I’m almost willing to overlook the tiny remote it comes with. Where it not for the fact I can actually sync the soundbar to my fire stick remote, I’d really be upset. It only came with the optical cable which didn’t bother me as this was what I intended on usin but beware, as there was nothing else in the box other than the remote, the soundbar itself with the power cable and the optical cable. No other audio cable or screws came with it!

customer_reviews.title: Love this little gem
customer_reviews.text: Our 5-year old 55" Visio TV's speakers stopped working after crackling for 2 days...but picture and all else still sharp and working fine. We were SO bummed to possibly have to spend $300-$600 for a new TV. But ALAS! Thank goodness for external audio systems! We didn't need bells and whistles, just something to actually *hear* our TV again....and this little gem absolutely delivers. We're not audiophiles or into surround sound, movie quality TV experiences, etc...so this Polk Solo might not be the "best" audio option out there if you're into multiple levels of sound. But for us, it's a definite improvement! And it was waaaaay better than purchasing an entire new TV for one little issue! Thanks Polk!

product_meta.title: Polk Audio Signa Solo Sound Bar - Works with any TV | 10X More Bass | Voice Adjust Technology | Dolby Digital Surround Decoding | Black
product_meta.description: The Polk Signa Solo sound bar delivers an immersive home theater experience - far outperforming to your TV speakers. Plus, it takes minutes to set up. Features patented SDA surround technology that creates an expansive multi-dimensional soundstage and detailed stereo imaging for a wider, more immersive listening experience and Polk’s voice adjust technology that customizes the voice levels to reproduce clear, crisp dialogue so you never miss a single word of your favorite movie, TV show or sporting event. Four-driver array and built-in bass ports deliver deeper, punchier bass without the need for an external subwoofer—enjoy 10x more bass than your typical TV speakers. Built-in Bluetooth lets you stream all of your favorite music wirelessly.

HEAR EVERY WORD OF YOUR FAVORITE MOVIES, TV SHOWS AND SPORTING EVENTS – Polk's Patented Voice Adjust technology lets you customize the voice levels to reproduce clear, crisp dialogues
